div.l: But y am olde me list not to pley for age
Gras tyme is don̄ my fodder is now forage
Þis white top̄pe writeþ myn olde yeres
Myn hert is also mowled as myn heres
But if y fare as doth an open ers
That ilke fruyt is ever lenger þe wers
Til it be roten in Mullok or in stree
We olde men I drede so fare we
Tyl we be roten kan we not be rype
We hoppe alwey while þat þe worlde wol pipe
For in oure whil þer stiketh eủere anaile
To have an hore here and a grene taile
Has hath a leke for þough oure myght be gon
Oure wil desireth foly ever in oon
For when we may noȝt don̄ þan wol we speke
Yet in oure asshen olde is fire y reke
Foure gledes have we which y shal devyse
Auantyng lyyng Anger Covetise
Þese foure sparkkes longon vnto elde
Oure olde lyve mow byn vnelde
But whil ne shal noȝt failen it is sooth
And yet have þei alwey a coltes tooth
As many a yere as it is passed hend
Sen þat my tappe of lyfe bigon to renne
For sikerly when y was born̄ a non
Deth drough þe tappe of lyf and let it gon̄
And eủere seth hath so þe tappe y ronne
Til þat almost al empty was þe tonne
Þe strem of lyf now droppeth on þe chymbe
Þe sely tonge may well ryng and chymbe
Of wrecchednesse þat passed is ful yore
With olde folke save dotage is namore
When þat oure hoost hedde hard þis ʆsermonyng
He gan to speke as lordly as a kyng
And seid what amounteth al þis wit
We shal speke al day of holy wryt
The deuel made a reve forto preche
Or of a sowter a shipman or a leche
Sey forth þi tale and tary not the tyme
Lo depford and it is halfe wey pryme
